title: Vino 2015 Pinot Grigio (Washington)
description: This wine is two-thirds Evergreen and one-third RAF vineyards, both in the Ancient Lakes appellation and all fermented and aged in stainless steel. It's spot on for the variety, with notes of whole Granny Smith apple and green melon. The palate redolent with sleek fresh apple and pear flavors that power through the finish. It's a standout at this price.

title: Volpaia 2013 Coltassala  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of underbrush, toasted oak and dark spice emerge on this firmly structured wine. It's rather austere, evoking dried black cherry, cranberry, star anise and espresso framed in racy acidity. Taut, close-grained tannins grip the finish. Drink 2018–2025.

title: Weingut Frank 2015 Ried Hoher Weg Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: A friendly, ripe and appetizing tone of yellow pear dominates the nose and palate of this wine. It's fluid in its flavors, with a yeasty edge that adds some texture and a touch of saltiness that lasts all the way through the finish.

title: Claire & Fabien Chasselay 2016 La Carrière  (Chénas)
description: From the Chasselay family's négociant business, this single-vineyard wine is lightly structured and full of blackberries. It has a future with its tannins and its mineral edge that need to soften. Drink this balanced wine from late 2018.

title: Costa di Bussia 2012 Bussia Vigna dei Buoi  (Barolo)
description: A few swirls of the glass release aromas of truffle, scorched earth, menthol and star anise. On the structured palate, assertive, close-grained tannins weave through dried Morello cherry, licorice and clove. Drink 2022–2030.

title: Captûre 2016 Les Pionniers Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)
description: Grass, melon and peach highlight a texture that's creamy and fleshy, with a well-honed balance of lingering acidity. Medium bodied, the wine offers additional flavors of dried herb and nutmeg.

title: Carmel Road 2014 North Crest Panorama Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: There's a great amount of minerality on the nose of this bottling, with crushed slate and muddy soil aromas overcoming the mint herb and red-fruit scents. There's minty lift right away on the sip, with bay leaf, fennel pollen and dusty leather flavors decorating the boysenberry fruit.

title: Castello di Radda 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of French oak, baked plum, espresso and a whiff of vanilla carry over to the smooth palate together with ripe cherry and a hint of star anise. Fine-grained tannins offer polished support.

title: Castello Vicchiomaggio 2013 La Prima Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of forest floor, prune, ground clove, a balsamic note and whiffs of exotic spice are front and center. The tight palate offers dried black cherry, espresso, sage, star anise and oak alongside close-grained tannins that grip the finish.

title: Cave de Tain 2015 Terre d'Ivoire  (Saint-Joseph)
description: Whispers of smoked nuts, vanilla and spice highlight savory tones of pressed yellow apple and pear in this richly textured white. Its delicate fruit flavors drink elegantly now but should develop greater densities of earth and mineral with age.

title: Domaine de la Présidente 2014 Grands Classiques Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: Whiffs of black-cherry pie and strawberry yogurt lend a primary, fruity feel to this voluptuous red. While soft in acidity and richly textured, it offers fine, firm tannins that lend backbone to the finish.

title: Domaine de Verquiere 2013  Gigondas
description: Delicate whiffs of mocha and spice accentuate luscious, juicy flavors of ripe blackberry and plum. This wine is plump and plush in mouthfeel but balanced by fresh acidity and a firm, tannic finish.

title: Domaine des Marrans 2016  Juliénas
description: The wine, always structured, is particularly strong and tannic in this vintage. It has density and plenty of dry tannins that at the moment have a hard edge. This structure will stand the otherwise ripe and fruity wine in good stead as it ages, but it will take time. Drink from 2019.

title: Château de Nages 2015 JT White (Costières de Nîmes)
description: A pleasantly waxy slick enriches flavors of fresh apple, pear and lemon in this ripe, richly textured white. Hints of spice and saline minerality linger elegantly on the finish.

title: Cafaggio 2015  Chianti Classico
description: New leather, dark spice, truffle and fleshy plum aromas take center stage. On the well-structured palate, close-knit, polished tannins support mature black cherry, clove and star anise. Drink through 2020.

title: Alain Jaume et Fils 2015 Les Valats Red (Rasteau)
description: Hints of smoke and licorice lend spice to this unctuous, slightly warming red. Black-plum and blueberry flavors are fleshy and ripe but offset by ripe, rigid tannins and fresh acidity.

title: Albert Bichot 2016 La Madone  (Fleurie)
description: This Beaune-based négociant has made this wine in a Burgundian style, with oak fermentation and aging in vats for up to nine months. The result is a rich wine that will age. Its tannins, spice and rich structure speak to the wood flavors. The fruit balances that, giving richness and concentration. Drink the wine from 2019.

title: Barone Ricasoli 2015 Brolio Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: This robust red is 80% Sangiovese, 15% Merlot and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon. It opens with aromas of black currant, cedar and a hint of violet while the firmly structured palate offers dried black cherry, vanilla, licorice and a touch of mocha. Assertive but polished tannins provide support.

title: Birichino 2016 Saint Georges Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Very light in the glass, this bottling from an old vineyard shows candied pomegranate, sage and thyme on the delicate nose. There is solid grip to the sip, with tangy cranberry and a pinch of white pepper. It is a great red wine for a sunny day.

title: Angeline 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Generous flavors and full body give this wonderful and affordable wine a warm feel on the palate. Rich black cherry, black tea and cranberry notes offer a lot of complexity. The texture is broad and full, but infused with moderate tannins and subtle acidity that keep it fresh.

title: Antiyal 2015 Pura Fe Carmenère (Maipo Valley)
description: Jammy berry aromas are a bit heavy and stewed, with a balsamic leaning. That's a fair indication of what's to come: namely a saturated palate with a slightly disjointed mix of blackberry, prune and licorice flavors. A chocolaty flavor takes over on a heavy meandering finish.

title: Baehner Fournier 2014 V3 Red (Los Olivos District)
description: Dark loamy soil aromas meet with packed violets, red rose petals, crushed gravel and dense blueberry on the nose of this blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Merlot and 20% Petit Verdot. The palate is quite tangy for the grapes in involved, with hints of balsamic reduction sauce, black pepper and underripe black fruit.

title: Bersano 2012 Badarina  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of toasted oak, dark spice, grilled herb and coconut lift out of the glass. On the firm palate, assertive, close-grained tannins offset black cherry extract and a hint of star anise. Drink 2020–2027.

title: Bibbiano 2014 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Taut and firmly structured, this offers aromas of French oak, espresso, Asian spice and a whiff of moist soil. The firmly structured palate offers raspberry, wild cherry, dried sage and licorice framed in tightly drawn, fine-grained tannins. Vibrant acidity provides balance. It's youthfully assertive so give it a few more years to unwind.

title: Domaine Matray 2016 Cuvée Vieilles Vignes  (Juliénas)
description: This structured wine offers dark fruits and a dry core of tannins. It has weight and the potential of rich fruitiness. The concentration from old vines adds to the aging potential. Drink this wine from 2019.

title: Eredi Enzo Raspi 2015 Bandini Villa Pomona  (Chianti Classico)
description: New leather, forest floor, woodland berry and a whiff of violet are all classic Sangiovese aromas. It's ripe but bright, offering mature wild cherry, white pepper and a hint of clove alongside compact tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Francesco Rinaldi 2013  Barolo
description: Earthy aromas of truffle, underbrush, woodland berry, blue flower and a whiff of game lead the nose. The linear, austere palate is on the lean side, offering tart red cherry, star anise and clove framed in taut, close-grained tannins and racy acidity. Give it time to fully unfold and come together. Drink after 2023.

title: Geografico 2013 Contessa di Radda Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: This 90% Sangiovese, 5% Canaiolo and 5% Colorino blend has aromas of black-skinned berry, baking spice and leather. The juicy palate offers ripe black cherry, clove and licorice alongside firm, polished tannins. Drink through 2024.

title: Gershon Bachus 2013 Auster Syrah (California)
description: Clove, allspice and black cherry juice show on the nose of this bottling from the heart of Temecula. Tangy wild berry fruit pops on the sip, where a chalky texture carries vanilla cookie, wild fennel and, toward the finish, and mocha flavors.

title: Imagery 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: Delicious ripe apple and pear aromas meet equally vivid and enjoyable fruit flavors in this medium-bodied, soft and easy-drinking wine. Just a touch of lemony acidity brings a little lift on the palate and keeps the finish nicely fresh.
